results.title: Set in a Mysterious Realm, Handel’s Baroque ‘Alcina’ Returns to the Stage
results.abstract: A Norwegian production, directed by Francisco Negrin, revives the composer's opera with period instruments.

results.title: A Literary Tour on the Blue Danube
results.abstract: "Danubia,'' by Simon Winder, offers a quirky and fun trip through the old Hapsburg Empire, whose history is bloody, complicated and rarely humorous.

results.abstract: A range of institutions across the world are expanding their collections and their horizons to reflect the growing role of new technologies.

results.abstract: The idea of Beyoncé and Jay-Z as marriage ambassadors raises hard questions for both ends of the political spectrum.

results.title: A Lavish and Folkloric Production of Janacek’s ‘Jenufa’
results.abstract: Alvis Hermanis's direction of the piece at La Monnaie in Brussels pays tribute to the work's Moravian roots.

results.title: Lyon Festival Pulls Down Musical Barriers
results.abstract: The Aire de Jeu festival, which started Tuesday in Lyon, will highlight work from the young American composer Nico Muhly.

results.title: A Soprano Glows in ‘Elektra’
results.abstract: To mark the 150th anniversary of Richard Strauss's birth this year, the Semper Opera has kicked off the celebrations with a new production of the German composer's work.

results.title: Exhibition Traces Bauhaus Luminary’s Struggle With His Past
results.abstract: An exhibition in Berlin follows the trajectory of the graphic artist Herbert Bayer, who in the 1930s created Nazi propaganda, though he claimed to be apolitical.

results.title: A British-American Feast on the London Stage
results.abstract: From Harold Pinter to Eugene O'Neill and from musicals to plays, theater in 2013 offered an unusually abundant array from both sides of the Atlantic.

results.title: ‘Mokujiki Fever’ Endures
results.abstract: A show at the Pace Gallery in London examines the power that was unleashed by a 1920s Japanese craft movement.

results.title: Paradoxes for Country Opera
results.abstract: At smaller houses scattered around the British countryside, the ideal is still a sense of being welcomed to a private party on a grand estate.
